Brij Bhushan Kabra (1937 – 12 April 2018) was an Indian musician. He popularized the guitar as an instrument in Indian classical music. He was born in Jodhpur, British Raj.
Kabra became the first Indian musician to play "raga" on the guitar, performed publicly, and recorded the successful album "Call of the Valley" (1967) with "bansuri" player Hariprasad Chaurasia and "santoor" player Shivkumar Sharma in 1960.
Kabra died on 12 April 2018 in Ahmedabad, India of multiple organ failure at age 81.
